update.description:
Changed method of passing genomedata archive names and track indexes to segway task during the identify and posterior tasks to match train. Before identify would pass the unique archive names separated by commas and the track indexes separated by commas for one archive, and semi-colons between archives. Meaning two archives with one and two tracks would be passed as:

> “../gd\_archive1,../gd\_archive2“ “0,1;0“

This was changed to match train, which passes an archive multiple times, once for each track present. The previous example therefore becomes

> “../gd\_archive1,../gd\_archive1,../gd\_archive2“ “0,1,0“

This solves a previously described bug, where segway would fail during identify if given archives with different number of tracks.

Modified the multiple datasets test case, by adding an additional track to two of the four genomedata archives provided. This gives a situation where two worlds are trained, each with two genomedata archives with one and two tracks in them. The added track is a clone of one of the existing ones, meaning the finally viterbi output remained unchanged, though the params obviousl did.
update.title: Multiple gd archive

content.raw: @{557058:c80ca578-03a1-4ac6-b3ee-50372a3fceee} This is ready to be merged.
content.html: @Eric Roberts This is ready to be merged.

content.raw: I was hoping to have more distinction between the two tracks in the make\_genomedata script, in case we eventually wanted to change the third track to differ. These can be removed however.
content.html: I was hoping to have more distinction between the two tracks in the make_genomedata script, in case we eventually wanted to change the third track to differ. These can be removed however.

content.raw: This file seems to have been added in error. It is not used by run.sh or part of the touchstone. Further, the command it records is a part of simpleseg not even multipledatasets
content.html: This file seems to have been added in error. It is not used by run.sh or part of the touchstone. Further, the command it records is a part of simpleseg not even multipledatasets

content.raw: No. In this case one world would one archive with two tracks and the other would have two archives with one track each. This does not test the issue of having multiple gd archive with differing track numbers within the same world, which the PR aims to fix.
content.html: No. In this case one world would one archive with two tracks and the other would have two archives with one track each. This does not test the issue of having multiple gd archive with differing track numbers within the same world, which the PR aims to fix.

content.raw: Wouldn’t it be sufficient to have a 1a, 2a, and a 12b genomedata in this case and forgo the 3rd track?
content.html: Wouldn’t it be sufficient to have a 1a, 2a, and a 12b genomedata in this case and forgo the 3rd track?

content.raw: If these are identical to another track in the testcase - why not just reuse their bed file?
content.html: If these are identical to another track in the testcase - why not just reuse their bed file?
